metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3995 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A logic error was found in the libmount library of util-linux in thefunction that allows an unprivileged user to unmount a FUSE filesystem.This flaw allows an unprivileged local attacker to unmount FUSE filesystemsthat belong to certain other users who have a UID that is a prefix of theUID of the attacker in its string form. An attacker may use this flaw tocause a denial of service to applications that use the affectedfilesystems.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdextrautils - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
eject - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
fdisk - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
libblkid1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
libfdisk1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
libmount1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
libsmartcols1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
libuuid1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
mount - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
rfkill - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
util-linux - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
util-linux-locales - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
uuid-runtime - 2.37.2-4ubuntu2
bsdutils - 1:2.37.2-4ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.37.2-4ubuntu2').
util-linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.37.2-4ubuntu2').
